definition: to quarrel/to fall out with sb
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
eye/item/section/list/catalogue/table of contents/order (taxonomy)/goal/name/title
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
man and wife fall out (idiom, from Book of Changes); marital strife

sentences.english: Sometimes siblings betray to each other in order to posse a piece of legacy.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，兄弟姐妹反目成仇，为的是多的一份财产。

sentences.english: You can not joke an enemy into a friend, but you may a friend into an enemy.
sentences.chinese: 开玩笑不可能化敌为友，却可能让朋友反目为仇。

sentences.english: Siblings become enemies, fighting over assets that are left.
sentences.chinese: 所遗家产，成为兄弟反目，争相抢夺。

sentences.english: The goal was to quickly turn residents against their new government.
sentences.chinese: 这样做的目标是加快当地居民对新政府反目。

sentences.english: The two brothers have finally patched up their quarrel after years of bitter animosity.
sentences.chinese: 这对兄弟反目成仇了几年后终于和好了。

sentences.english: Everyone knew that they had been on bad terms.
sentences.chinese: 每私都知道他们反目睦。

sentences.english: Once we were close like brothers; now we have become enemies.
sentences.chinese: 曾经的亲密兄弟，现在却反目成仇。

sentences.english: A quarrel over an inheritance estranged the brothers for many years.
sentences.chinese: 因遗产反目使兄弟两疏远多年。

sentences.english: I don't want to turn against you.
But the invasion divided brother from brother, neighbour from neighbour.
sentences.chinese: 但侵略让兄弟反目，让邻里成仇。

sentences.english: Thou canst not joke an enemy into a friend, but thou mayest a fiend into an enemy.
sentences.chinese: 开玩笑不可能化敌为友，却可能让朋友反目成仇。

sentences.english: There are too many cases in which family members and friends quarrel with each other and become enemies, aren't there?
sentences.chinese: 亲戚朋友之间因为金钱而反目成仇的事儿还少吗？

sentences.english: Carelessly spoken words can sometimes unsolder ties of friendship.
sentences.chinese: 出言不慎有时会使朋友反目。

sentences.english: Friends are exposed as foes, heroes take on the taint of criminals, and no one can be trusted completely.
sentences.chinese: 朋友反目成仇，英雄堕落犯罪，无人可以完全信赖。

sentences.english: Sibling rivalry turned into betrayal between two brothers.

definition: to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to become enemies/to become hostile towards
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
to meet on the battlefield (idiom)

internecine strife (idiom); fighting among oneself
to not get along well/to be at odds
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to start a feud/to become enemies
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
hostility/animosity
foe/one's personal enemy
to be estranged
to arouse dislike/to incur hatred
